topics.body:
"@AppleJackFrost":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f400df6368727456f30d00#post_54f400df6368727456f30d00
[bq="AppleJackFrost"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f4008f6368726654c80000#post_54f4008f6368726654c80000
You can now imagine all those sales in your head.[/bq]
It makes sense really.  Valve is already vomiting money so having a VR helmet that is already compatible with steam games would cause them to have even more money.

No offense to anyone that's a fan of either company, but I totally fucking called it that this would happen that facebook would get all excited about oculus and then valve would swoop in with a VR helmet specifically for games cause they understand their consumer base whereas facebook wants VR school.

Facebook, "woohoo!  Virtual reality school!  Now you can go to school at home after you've come from school and work!"
Valve, "Fuck that!  1080p bitches!  60fps!  Compatible with all valve made games!  EXTREME REALISM!"

I knew Facebook was going to fuck over the oculus cause the second they said "virtual reality work" my instant thought was "whelp byebye oculus".

topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f4054d6368723adca10600#post_54f4054d6368723adca10600
To Sum up What G specifically is about.

Every four years each nation rallies one fighter in a giant robot called a Gundam, The Nation Whos Gundam fighter is left standing gets to rule the universe. (And Meanwhile, A Super Gundam known as the Dark Gundam has landed on earth and is trying to exterminate humanity.)

It's over the top in the best way possible. (National stereotype robots, Martial arts, Ki blasts, And lots of shouting.)
